reviews.review_msg: Dr. Nye is an intellegent & charasmatic professor, but I was disappointed in her teaching style. The lecture changed from in person/online randomly & with short warning. She cancelled two classes for no reason last minute (once because it was a nice day) & still had us read slides/ do the in class work. I didn't pay to take a self-directed class.

One of the best professors I have ever taken at SFU! Coleman genuinely cares about her students inside and outside of the classroom and is always willing to accommodate if you reach out. If you have the chance to take a class with her (especially an upper level) do it!!!

Prof. Nye is one of the most caring professors I have ever had. The class was welcoming, and it was so clear she cares for students' wellbeing. The content was more than interesting and readings were carefully chosen.

Horrible. Takes entire semester to mark, instructions make no sense and contradict themselves, docks marks for disagreeing. The content of the course made no sense according to the description. Contradicts herself in the marking as well. Genuinely the worst prof I've ever had

Assignments literally take the entire semester for her to grade. Grading criteria for assignments will contradict itself several times. One of the assignments is an essay about how ChatGPT has limitations, which has nothing to do with the course itself. The course itself was interesting but she made it unbearable.

I've taken 3 courses with Coleman and she is truly an incredible prof! Not only do I feel like I learned a lot, but I feel like I am leaving the class a better person. She is so compassionate if anything comes up for you during the semester and truly cares about every one of her students. Get ready to be inspired in every single lecture!

Coleman is a treasure! She's genuinely so caring and wants her students to not only do well but to be well. The class isn't super structured: she lets students lead a lot of the discussion. She gives lots of ways to get participation marks and lots of wiggle room on assignments, so I was never stressed out in her class. Absolutely take if you can!

Professor Nye was fantastic! I loved her class, she teaches about important and thought-provoking topics. She gives a lot of free reign when it comes to paper/projects which is nice because you can put time/effort into topics that you find interesting. A relatively easy and fair marker as long as you can show the time/effort/thought you put in!

She is amazing. Pros: Lectures were fun and engaging. Flexible with deadlines. Really cares about the topics. Easy participation marks. Assignments have lots of options. Cons: No lecture notes - just ppts w/ pictures+notes for herself 5min before lec. Takes attendance. REALLY SLOW marker. Got prev assignment feedback the day final essay was due.

Coleman is SFU's greatest treasure. This is the third class I've taken with her and every one of them has been exceptional. She designs courses in a very accommodating way (i.e. 3 day grace period for handing in assignments, make-up marks possible, no tests). It's easy to do well in her classes and you'll be a better person for having taken them!

Coleman was so engaging! She always made 4 hour lectures enjoyable. I took her course in the spring and she was a real gem when it came to online classes. She made the final paper optional for those of us struggling and was super accommodating. The class was also really interesting and interdisciplinary. Highly recommend her and the class!

Dr. Nye is a fantastic prof. She is passionate and knowledgeable about what she teaches, conveys complicated subject matter in an easy to understand way, and her classes feel comfortable and friendly. She shows a genuine interest in her students well-being and wants you to learn, not memorize. I refer back to things learned in her class often!

Coleman is such an awesome prof! She is incredibly sweet, I took her class in my first semester and she helped me a lot! She really cares about her students and about the subject matter,. She also gives incredibly interesting lectures, I never dreaded going to her class! I definitely want to take another class with her soon!
Such a wise woman! I can't get enough of her lectures.

SUPPERR nice.. Wish we had more professors like her. The class itself was easy. Only issue I have with Coleman is that she takes forever to mark. However, hands down one of the bests profs I have ever had.

Coleman is an amazing professor! If you take a class with her, you will not regret it! She tries her best to get to know her students and is very helpful when it comes to providing feedback. That being said, be prepared to engage with the material during class, so do your readings!

Coleman is probably my favourite prof at SFU. She's extremely caring, intelligent, and passionate about what she teaches. She always has interesting content and brings in fun and relevant examples and exercises into her classes. She's really pushed me to uncover my own assumptions and think in new ways, and made my experience at SFU so much better.

Coleman is an incredible prof, if you do the readings, show up to class, participate, and engage with assignments you will get an a. Sounds like a lot of work, but Coleman makes learning exciting so it doesn't feel like it. I have taken four classes with her and all of them are similar in that the reading load is heavy, but all good reads!

Coleman is easily one of SFU's best! Her immense knowledge of & passion for the material come through. Very kind & approachable; encourages discussion, but no forced graded participation nonsense. Clear on asgmt. expectations & reasonably flexible. No exams, fair-marker. Attend lectures, put in the work, & youll definitely get a GPA boost. 10/10

I had GSWS 315 with Professor Nye Spring 2018. She is incredibly knowledge on the content and it is clear that she is passionate about what she is teaching. On the other hand, she tends to be quite abrupt, emailing with her is horrendous as asking minor questions feels like your giving her the biggest inconvenience.

I really loved Coleman when I took Critical Disability Studies as a special topics GSWS course in Spring 2017 (she now has it as a full course!). A lot of the reading materials were really eye-opening and Coleman was great at facilitating discussion. She also organized a potluck lunch thing for us at the end of the semester which was really nice!
